question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are processing streaming data from an external data provider.
You have the following code segment.


For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
discussion:
NO, YES, YES

First row will be Washington, Contoso, 400

Fabrikam in Seattle will have 2 because row_rank_dense allows ties

Yes, in both cases it will be 1

NO, YES, YES

Location	Company	UnitsSold	Rank
Washington DC	Contoso	400	1
Washington DC	Litware	300	2
Seattle	Contoso	300	1
Seattle	Litware	100	2
Seattle	Fabrikam	100	2
San Francisco	Relecloud	500	1
San Francisco	Litware	500	1
New York	Litware	1000	1
New York	Contoso	300	2
New York	Relecloud	300	2
New York	Fabrikam	200	3

N0, Yes, Yes

NO, YES, YES

No
Yes
Yes

Washington DC	Litware	300	2

Seattle	Litware	100	2
Seattle	Fabrikam	100	2

NO,YES,YES
Sorted and Ranked Output:
Location	Company	UnitsSold	Rank
Washington DC	Contoso	400	1
Washington DC	Litware	300	2
Seattle	Contoso	300	1
Seattle	Litware	100	2
Seattle	Fabrikam	100	2
San Francisco	Relecloud	500	1
San Francisco	Litware	500	1
New York	Litware	1000	1
New York	Contoso	300	2
New York	Relecloud	300	2
New York	Fabrikam	200	3

No, No, Yes
Rows with the same UnitsSold value share the same rank

NO, YES, YES

All the answers are wrong. The correct answers are no, yes, yes:

datatable(Location:string, Company:string, UnitsSold:long)
[
    "New York", "Contoso", 300,
    "New York", "Litware", 1000,
    "New York", "Relecloud", 300,
    "New York", "Fabrikam", 200,
    "Seattle", "Contoso", 300,
    "Seattle", "Litware", 100,
    "Seattle", "Fabrikam", 100,
    "San Francisco", "Relecloud", 500,
    "San Francisco", "Litware", 500,
    "Washington DC", "Litware", 300,
    "Washington DC", "Contoso", 400
]
| sort by Location desc, UnitsSold desc
| extend Rank = row_rank_dense(UnitsSold, prev(Location) != Location)

No, Yes, Yes
Company is not part of ranking in this case.

No, Yes Yes

No-Yes-No

Litware from New York will be displayed at the top of the result (N) 

Sorting prioritizes Location in descending order, so rows from locations like "Washington DC" or "San Francisco" will appear before "New York." Thus, Litware from New York will not be at the top. 

Fabrikam in Seattle will have value = 2 in the Rank column (Y) 

Within the "Seattle" location, Fabrikam and Litware both have UnitsSold = 100. These rows are tied, and row_rank_dense assigns both a rank of 2 because dense ranking skips no numbers. 

Litware in San Francisco will have the same value in the Rank column as Litware in New York (N) 

The row_rank_dense function assigns ranks independently for each Location. "Litware" in San Francisco and "Litware" in New York belong to different partitions and will have different ranks.

Sorting: Rows are first sorted by Location in descending order (alphabetically) and then by UnitsSold in descending order

Ranking: The row_rank_dense function assigns ranks within each Location. Rows with the same UnitsSold value share the same rank, and the next rank increments without gaps.

No Yes No
